SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

Class Deck

java.lang.Object
  Deck

public class Deck
extends Object

This is the Deck class. It has all the methods relating to the Deck object. Which include: Three ways of sorting, shuffling, increasing and decreasing the size of Decks, finding patterns in the Deck, Generating histograms, etc. NOTE: THERE ARE SOME METHODS IN THE DECK CLASS THAT HAVE NOT BEEN INVOKED AND ARE NOT NECCESARY. HOWEVER, THEY MIGHT HAVE BEEN PART OF THE PREVIOUS ALGORITHM AND/OR MAY HELP IN LATER VERSIONS AND ENHANCEMENTS OF THE GAME.

Version:
Version 0.1(Basic)
Author:
Nived.Kodavali

          This is a non-parameterised constructor which creates a Deck object whick is an array of cards this array is fully populated and has 52 Card objects.

Method Detail

checkSequence

public static int checkSequence(Deck deck)
This method takes a Deck and checks whether it has a sequence in it(a set of cards where there are no gaps between the cards). If it does, it returns the the index number of where it starts. However if there aren't any sequences, it returns -1;

Parameters:
deck - A Deck that needs to be checked for a sequence.
Returns:
int.

copyDeck

public void copyDeck(Deck a)
This is a non-static method which copies the larger of the two Decks onto this Deck.

Parameters:
a - A Deck.

copyDeck

public static Deck copyDeck(Deck a,
                            Deck b)
This is an overloaded version of copyDeck that is a semi modifier. It copies the contents of the second parameter Deck onto the first.

Parameters:
a - A deck into which the contents of the other Deck needs to be copied.
a - The Deck which needs to be replicated and returned.
Returns:
Deck - A deck which is a copy of Deck a.

Returns:
hist - an array of integers which contain values based on the frequency of the Cards in the Deck.

- int.

isPair

public static boolean isPair(Deck hand)
This method checks for a pair. It returns true if the parameter Deck has a pair in it. A pair is a couple of Cards where both the cards have the same rank.

Parameters:
deck - The Deck which might contain a Pair and needs to be checked.
Returns:
isP - A boolean value to indicate whether there is a pair present in the Deck.

public static boolean isSequence(Deck deck)
This method checks if there is a sequence in the given Deck and returns a true if there is and a false if there is not.

Parameters:
deck - The Deck that is to be checked for the sequence.
Returns:
boolean - Depending upon whether there is a sequence in the Deck, a true if a sequence is present otherwise a alse.

makeBigger

public static Deck makeBigger(Deck deck)
This method takes a Deck and returns a new Deck which is bigger by one Card(an extra Card object is added at the back of the Deck).

Parameters:
deck - A Deck which needs to be made bigger by one Crad.
Returns:
deck1 - A Deck that is an exact replica of the parameter Deck except for a extra Card object in the ending.

makeSmaller

public static Deck makeSmaller(Deck deck)
This is a method that helps in avoiding NullPointerExceptions which occur very often when a loop traverses a deck and encounters a null object. This method takes a Deck whick may contain null objects and returns a new Deck which is void of nulls.

Parameters:
deck - A Deck object which may have null Cards which need to be removed.
Returns:
deck1 - A copy of the parameter Deck except that this one does not have nulls that may have veen present in the parameter Deck.

moveDown

public void moveDown()
This is a static method where all the cards in this Deck are shifted one place forward(So the oneth card becomes the zeroeth card and so on).

moveUp

public void moveUp()
This is a static method where all the cards in this Deck are shifted one place backwards(So the zeroeth card becomes the oneth card and so on).

nullExchange

public void nullExchange()
It is an instance method where this Deck which may contain null objects is modified and the null objects are 'pushed' to the back of the Deck. NOTE: PRESENTLY, IT DOES NOT WORK PROPERLY, HOWEVER, IT IS NOT NEEDED IN THIS VERSION OF THE GAME.

nullHist

public static int[] nullHist(Deck deck)
This method takes a Deck object and eturns a integer histogram the length of the Deck where each int (-1(if nul)or 0)represents the presence of nulls.

Parameters:
deck - The Deck which may contain nulls and whise nullHist is needed.

randomInt

public static int randomInt(int low,
                            int high)
This is a recursive method that takes any two limits(one higher and one lower)and return a random integer that lie between the limits(including both of them).

Parameters:
low - the integer that is the lower limit for the random number.
high - the integer that is the higher limit for the random number.
Returns:
int - a 'random' integer generated by the computer

rankHist

public static int[] rankHist(Deck deck)
This method returns a histogram containing the number of Cards of each rank are there.

Parameters:
deck - A Deck whose rank histogram is needed.
Returns:
rankH - int[] containing integers for the number of times each rank appears in the Deck.

rankSort

public static Deck rankSort(Deck deck)
This method is yet another srting algorithm This method has been written to cater to the needs of players who find it hard to visualise the Cards. Instead of returning a Deck sorted in the standard way, it returns a Deck that is sorted rank-wise.(the Aces(in suit wise order)) come first, then the deuces and so on. It helps a player when he wants to make a triplet or a four of a kind in the game.

Parameters:
deck - The Deck which needs to be sorted rank-wise.
Returns:
Deck - A replica of the parameter Deck just that it is sorted rank-wise.

seqLength

public static int seqLength(Deck deck,
                            int starting)
This method is normally invoked with right after Deck.checkSequence. It takes the index of where a sequence begins in a Deck and then returns the length of the sequence.

Parameters:
deck - The Deck in which there might be a sequence.
starting - The int for the first index of the sequence.
Returns:
length - The integer containing the length of the sequence.

shuffleDeck

public void shuffleDeck()
This method takes a Deck of Cards and then shuffles them up by swapping two cards at a time.

sortDeck

public static Deck sortDeck(Deck deck)
This is a sorting method which finds the lowest Card and switches it with the Card at the first place, then the second lowest Card is switched with the Card at the second place and so on.

Parameters:
deck - The Deck that needs to be sorted.
Returns:
A sorted version of the previous Deck.

subDeck

public static Deck subDeck(Deck deck,
                           int low,
                           int high)
                    throws Exception
This method takes a Deck and two indexes high and low to specify the range. It then creates a new Deck of length high-low+1 and assigns the corresponding values of the earlier deck to the newly created Deck. It essentially replicates part of a given Deck.

Parameters:
deck - The master deck whose subDeck is needed.
low - The integer for the lower limit of the subDeck needed.
high - The integer for the higher limit of the subDeck needed.
Returns:
sub - The deck that is the subDeck of the master Deck as specified.
Throws:
Exception

swapCard

public static void swapCard(Deck deck,
                            int a,
                            int b)
This method takes a Deck of Cards and two ints. It then swaps the references of the Cards at the two given indexes.

Parameters:
deck - A Deck in which the Cards need to be swapped.
a - An int containing one of the indexes of one of the Crads that needs to be swapped.
b - An int containing one of the indexes of one of the Crads that needs to be swapped.
